results.title: How the Oscars and Grammys Thrive on the Lie of Meritocracy
results.abstract: Despite all the markers of excellence, contenders like Danielle Deadwyler, Viola Davis and Beyoncé weren’t recognized for the highest honors. Niche awards don’t suffice.

multimedia.caption: Danielle Deadwyler in “Till.” She had to show public restraint as a grieving mother, while other actresses were lauded for emotional excess.

results.title: ‘Magic Mike’s Last Dance’ Review: Stripping Down to Bare Essentials
results.abstract: Channing Tatum returns as Florida’s favorite male exotic dancer, romancing a restless socialite played by Salma Hayek Pinault.

results.title: A Man Hanging From a Clock. Yes, It’s That Silent Film.
results.abstract: “Safety Last!,” the 1923 Harold Lloyd movie best known for the dangerous scene, marks its centennial.

multimedia.caption: Harold Lloyd in the 1923 movie “Safety Last!” A safety net was constructed on a roof about one floor below the action, though the scene was shot to look as though there was a sheer drop to the bustling streets far below.

results.title: Carlos Saura, a Leading and Enduring Spanish Director, Dies at 91
results.abstract: Called “one of the fundamental filmmakers in the history of Spanish cinema,” he began making movies under Franco, often hiding his messages in allegory.

multimedia.caption: Carlos Saura in 2017. He was adept at getting around government censors during the Franco dictatorship.
Carlos Saura in 2017. He was adept at getting around government censors during the Franco dictatorship.
Carlos Saura in 2017. He was adept at getting around government censors during the Franco dictatorship.

results.title: Sandra Seacat, Much Admired Acting Coach, Dies at 86
results.abstract: She helped Laura Dern, Marlo Thomas, Mickey Rourke and many others overcome fears, find their characters and discover “the joy of acting.”

results.title: Solomon Perel, Jew Who Posed as a Hitler Youth to Survive, Dies at 97
results.abstract: His masquerade — a tale recounted in a memoir and in the film “Europa Europa” — saved his life. But “to this day,” he said, “I have a tangle of two souls in one body.”

multimedia.caption: Solomon Perel in an undated photo. “I’m not a Jew,” he lied to his Wehrmacht captors in 1941. “I’m an ethnic German.”
Solomon Perel in an undated photo. “I’m not a Jew,” he lied to his Wehrmacht captors in 1941. “I’m an ethnic German.”
Solomon Perel in an undated photo. “I’m not a Jew,” he lied to his Wehrmacht captors in 1941. “I’m an ethnic German.”

results.title: How Much to See a Movie at AMC? It Will Soon Depend Where You Sit.
results.abstract: By the end of 2023, the movie theater chain will offer tickets at three different price tiers, with middle seats costing the most. You’ll pay less if you like the front row.

multimedia.caption: AMC said its new pricing system would not be applied to tickets for discounted Tuesday screenings or showings before 4 p.m.
